title: Harder General Knowledge Quiz III (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair across pop culture, history, science, geography, and tech. No sports content.

items.q: Who wrote the play Romeo and Juliet?
Which animated film features a talking snowman named Olaf?
What is the name of the wizarding school in Harry Potter?
items.a: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

items.q: Which composer wrote the Moonlight Sonata?
Which 1982 film features the line “Phone home”?
Who wrote The Hobbit?
What is the stage name of the singer Stefani Germanotta?
Which video game franchise features the supersoldier Master Chief?
In Friends, what is the name of Ross’s sister?
Who directed Pulp Fiction?
Which city was the RMS Titanic built in?
Who became the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom?
The ancient city of Carthage lay in the territory of which modern country?
What event on July 14, 1789, is often taken as the start of the French Revolution?
Who led India’s independence movement using nonviolent resistance?
Which U.S. president issued the Emancipation Proclamation?
The Rosetta Stone enabled scholars to decipher which writing system?
Which empire built the ancient ‘Royal Road’ for swift communication?
Who was the last queen of France before the Revolution?
Which founding document of the United States begins with “We the People”?
What is the scientific study of earthquakes called?
Which vitamin is synthesized in human skin when exposed to sunlight?
What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
Which organs filter blood and produce urine?
What is the most abundant element in the Sun?
Which cell structures contain chlorophyll and carry out photosynthesis?
What is the speed of light in vacuum (km/s, to the nearest thousand)?
Which subatomic particles carry a negative charge?
What is the chemical formula for table salt?
What do we call an animal that eats both plants and animals?
What is the capital of Japan?
Which is the longest river in Europe?
Dubrovnik is a city in which country?
What is the largest country in South America?
Which African lake is commonly cited as a source of the White Nile?
Which European country is famous for fjords and uses the krone?
What is the capital of Egypt?
Which U.S. city is nicknamed the “Windy City”?
What is the name of the strait between Spain and Morocco?
Which island nation lies just southeast of India?
What does URL stand for?
Who co‑founded Microsoft with Bill Gates?
Which language introduced by Apple in 2014 is widely used for iOS development?
What does HTML stand for?
What general name is given to always‑listening, voice‑controlled home devices like Alexa?
What does VPN stand for?
What kind of battery is commonly used in smartphones?
Which cloud storage service is integrated with Gmail?
What is the term for unsolicited bulk email?
What does the “QR” in QR code stand for?
